flammable_liquids.rationale: Category 3 based on UNRTDG Class: 3, PG3

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Not classified because of SPECIES: Rat; ENDPOINT: LD50; > 5000 mg/kg bw; REFERENCE SOURCE: EHC (1996)

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Considering rat dermal LD50 >2000, > 5000 mg/kg (EHC (1996)), it was set as Category which is lower toxicity from Category 3. But it could not be decided, it cannot be classified.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Inhalation study of gasoline was done that aerosol is mixed with steam, it was thought that aerosol is main. And It was set as Category 4 based on value 4.6mg/L (IUCLID (2000)) that is lower value of rat inhalation LC50.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was highly irritating in rabbit skin irritation tests. But it was classified as Category 2 because description of irreversible lesions is not observed (IUCLID (2000), EHC (1006)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the statement of slightly irritating (IUCLID (2000)) by the tests for rabbit eye irritation, it was set as Category 2B. This Category is also supported by the case report in human (eye irritation recovers in four days and injection recovers in 24 hours).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Not classified
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitization: Since there is no data, it cannot be classified. Skin sensitization: It was put outside of the division, based on the fact that the skin sensitization was not identified in the skin sensitization test with guinea pigs(IUCLID (2000), EHC (1996)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the negative results in the mice dominant lethality tests and in the rat myeloid cell chromosomal aberration tests (IUCLID (2000)), we classified it as Out Of Category.

carcinogenicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of causing cancer (state route of exposure if it is conclusively proven that no other routes of exposure cause the hazard)
carcinogenicity.rationale: It was set as 2 based on the category A3 by ACGIH. [special notes] EU has classified diesel fuels into category 3 (it will be Category 2 if a technical guide is obeyed), and desulfurization gas oil into a category 2 (it will be 1B if a technical guide is obeyed). Each of these is considered to be the classifications corresponding to gasoline. On the other hand, IARC classifies with a group 3 to Distillate(light) diesel fuel, and this will become the outside of Category if a technological direction is obeyed. As a result, category of light oil is distributed to 1B, 2, and out of category. By this classifications, the Japanese properties of diesel fuel was also taken into consideration, and it was set as 2.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Since there was no significant effect to the reproductive function and reproductive potential, and the development of neonatal in the rat administration test to female in premating and conception, during gravid period, and to male(ACGIH (2003)), it was considered as on the outside of Categry. This classification is supported also because it is not observed developmental toxicity in other test of pregnant rat administrated (EHC (1996))..

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs (kidneys); May cause respiratory irritation or may cause drowsiness and dizziness (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In the case in which gasoline was exposed in large quantities in humans, there are progressive oliguria and acute tubular necrosis (EHC (1996), ATSDR (1995)), it is classified into category 1(kidney). And based on investigation report of lethargica, coma by kerosene oral ingestion in human (ATSDR (1995)), it is classified into Category 3 (anaesthetic). Moreover, it is classified into Category 3 (respiratory irritation) based on the statement which stimulates a respiratory tracts (ICSC (2004)). In addition, lungs injury by aspiration was classified according to vacuum respiratory toxicity information.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (kidneys) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It was classified to as Category 1 (kidney) since that the acute renal tubular necrosis (EHC (1996), ATSDR (1995)), the acute renal damage accompanied by anemia and thrombocytopenia, etc. are reported in repeated exposure to humans (EHC (1996)).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May be fatal if swallowed and enters airways
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Category 1 because of "possible to cause chemical pneumonia by misswallowing of the liquid." (ATSDR, 1995)
